metadata.Title: CVE-2018-1000164 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - low.
metadata.Description: gunicorn version 19.4.5 contains a CWE-113: Improper Neutralization of CRLF Sequences in HTTP Headers vulnerability in "process_headers" function in "gunicorn/http/wsgi.py" that can result in an attacker causing the server to return arbitrary HTTP headers. This vulnerability appears to have been fixed in 19.5.0. It was discovered that gunicorn improperly handled certain input. An attacker could potentially use this issue execute a cross-site scripting (XSS) attack.

notes.Note: mdeslaur> there are no reverse-depends on gunicorn in trusty, lowering priority to low

criterions.comment: gunicorn: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
